[Purloining Cloak](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2401)
</title>

<traits>

</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 196 <sup>1.1</sup></row>

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** worn cloak

**Bulk** L
</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Perception** +30; [precise](/Rules.aspx?ID=411) vision 30 feet, [imprecise](/Rules.aspx?ID=412) hearing 30 feet

**Communication** speech ([Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1) and two other languages, usually regional and ancestral)

**Skills** [Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=14) +31, [Thievery](/Skills.aspx?ID=17) +31, [Underworld Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=8) +31

**Int** +5, **Wis** +5, **Cha** +5

**Will** +30 

</column>

---        

Each _purloining cloak_ is a [_mercurial mantle_](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1067) once worn by a legendary thief or two. The cloak became infused with a daredevil spirit and a penchant for high-stakes thievery. If its owner isn't willing to partake in such activities, the cloak tries to convince them to sell or give it to someone who will. A purloining cloak can use tendrils of its cloth to attempt [Thievery](/Skills.aspx?ID=17) checks to [Palm an Object](/Actions.aspx?ID=67) or [Steal](/Actions.aspx?ID=68), proudly offering you its loot later. In addition to those of a _mercurial mantle_, a _purloining cloak_ has the following activations.
